problem.p: A player flips two fair coins. The player win $3 if 2 heads occur and $1 if 1 head occurs. How much should the player lose if no heads occur for the game to be fair (expected gain is 0)

div.p: Let y = amount player loose on no heads. Let X = net gain after two coins flip. \(E[X]\)= 3*.25 + 1*.5 - y *.25. For game to be fair, E[X] = 0. Solving for y we get y=5. Therefore, player loose 5$ if no heads occur for the game to be fair.
